text.p: Terms were modified for the planned initial public offering in 2Connect Express Inc, lowering the proposed number of units and target price, lead underwriter Stern Agee & Leach said on Thursday.

The company proposed a total of 520,000 units consisting of two common shares and one warrant at a target price of $12.50, down from 700,000 units consisting of three common shares and one warrant at a target price of $9.25.
Previously 850,000 units were on offer. Originally, the company proposed one million shares at an estimated price range of $6 to $8 under lead underwriter Sovereign Equity Management.
The initial public offering, expected to trade on Friday, is expected to trade its units under the symbol "CNTCU."
2Connect retails Internet cellular paging and other communications products.
